name: Armament Awakening
description:
Upon Awakening Armament Haki.
  • Your initial Haki Pool is either 5 OR roll a 1d10.
  • Your initial Haki Cap is either 2 OR you can roll a 1d4 to determine.
  • Your initial Haki Dice is a d1.

name: Basic Offense I
description: Your haki dice while attacking becomes a 1d4.

name: Basic Defense I
description:
Your haki dice while blocking becomes a 1d4.
You can subtract bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage taken from an attack for each haki die used (subtracted after resistance).

name: Best Defense I
description: When you use haki for defense, you can use your reaction to add 5 (plus the normal haki dice) to the amount you decrease the dmg by.

name: Honed Steel I
description: You can go over your Haki Cap while defending with haki. When you choose how many haki dice to spend while defending, you can spend up to [Your Haki Cap +1].

name: Thick Skin I
description: As an action you can spend 3 haki points to form a small shield over your weapon/a body part for 1 minute. This gives you +1 to AC and decreases any dmg you take by 1 (per dmg source) with it for the duration or until you fall unconscious (you can use this even if your Haki Cap is less than 3)

name: Protective Overdrive I
description:
As a reaction you can activate Protective Overdrive to block a single attack.
For this single block,you can add 1 extra haki dice to the damage reduction and your Haki Cap increases by 1.

name: Elemental Guard I
description: When using haki, The effectiveness of defensive haki is no longer halved against following damage types: fire, lightning, poison, acid, thunder, radiant, necrotic, force.

name: Best Defense II
description: When you use your reaction to block with haki, you can keep your haki up until the start of your next turn. You can roll (the amount of haki dice you spent) +5 to decrease damage from every attack that targets you until the start of your next turn.

name: Honed Steel II
description: You can go over your Haki Cap while defending with haki. When you choose how many haki dice to spend while defending, you can spend up to [Your Haki Cap +2].

name: Thick Skin II
description: As an action you can spend 6 haki points to form a small shield over your weapon/a body part for 1 minute. This gives you +2 to AC and decreases any dmg you take by 2 (per dmg source) with it for the duration or until you fall unconscious (you can use this even if your Haki Cap is less than 6)

name: Best Offense I
description: As a bonus action, until the start of your next turn, you imbue your weapon/body with haki, 2 of your attacks can benefit from the amount of haki you spent on 1 attack

name: Honed Focus I
description: You can go over your Haki Cap when attacking with haki. When you choose how many haki points to spend on an attack roll, you can now spend up to (Your Haki Cap +1).

name: Black Blade I
description:
As an action you can spend 3 haki points to blacken your weapon/body part for 1 minute.
This gives you +1 to hit and dmg with it for the duration or until you fall unconscious (you can use this even if your Haki Cap is less than 3)

name: Best Offense II
description: As a bonus action, until the start of your next turn, you can now apply Haki to all of your attacks

name: Honed Focus II
description: While attacking you can now spend up to (Your Haki Cap +2).

name: Black Blade II
description:
As an action you can spend 6 haki points to blacken your weapon/body part for 1 minute.
This gives you +2 to hit and damage with it for the duration or until you fall unconscious (you can use this even if your Haki Cap is less than 6)

name: Haki Cap Increase
description: Your Haki Cap increases by 1.

name: Haki Cap Increase
description: Your Haki Cap increases by 1.

name: Haki Pool Increase
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 5 or 1d8.

name: Haki Pool Increase
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 5 or 1d8.

name: Haki Pool Increase
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 5 or 1d8.

name: Haki Pool Increase (Gamble)
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 1d10.

name: Haki Recharge
description: Your Haki Pool now fully refills on a short rest.

name: Full Body I
description:
requires Concentration. As a bonus action you can enter Full Body state.

In this state, you must spend twice the amount of haki dice you want to use up to your Haki Cap. If your Cap is 2, you can spend up to 4 points and gain the benefits from up to 2 points.
Until the start of your next turn, all of your attacks benefit from Full Body and every time someone attacks you, you can decrease the damage with your haki. Your haki dice becomes 1d2 for attacking and defending. At the start of your turn, you must again spend 2x the amount of haki dice you are using (you can change this amount at the start of your turn.)

name: Full Body II
description:
Requires Concentration.
While in Full Body:
  • Your haki dice becomes 1d4 for attacking and defending.
  • You can perform long and high jumps while standing and their distance is doubled.
  • You can prevent effects that would move/affect your position (such as knock back, prone, etc).
  • You gain +1 to hit on melee attacks.
  • You take -1 dmg from all sources.

name: Full Body III
description:
Requires Concentration. You can now use your reaction to enter Full Body.
While in Full Body:
  • Your haki cap increases by 1.
  • Your AC increases by 1
  • You gain +1 to hit on melee attacks
  • You gain +1 to hit on melee attacks.
  • You take -3 dmg from all sources

name: Full Body IV
description:
No longer requires Concentration. You can now use your reaction to enter Full Body.
While in Full Body:
  • Your haki dice becomes 1d6 for attacking and defending.
  • Your haki cap increases by 1.
  • Your AC increases by 1
  • You gain +1 to hit on melee attacks
  • You gain +1 to hit on melee attacks.
  • You take -3 dmg from all sources

name: Full Body V
description:
While in Full Body:
  • Your haki cap increases by 3.
  • Your AC increases by 3
  • You gain +3 to hit on melee attacks
  • You gain +3 to hit on melee attacks.
  • You take -10 dmg from all sources

name: Full Body VI
description:
While in Full Body:
  • Your haki dice becomes 1d8 for attacking and defending.
  • You can add 1 free haki dice roll when you attack or defend.

name: Basic Defense II
description:
Your haki dice while blocking becomes a 1d6.
You can subtract bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage taken from an attack for each haki die used (subtracted after resistance).

name: Basic Offense II
description: Your haki dice while attacking becomes a 1d6

name: Haki Pool Increase II
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 5 or 1d8.

name: Haki Cap Increase II
description: Your Haki cap increases by 1.

name: Haki Pool Increase (Gamble) II
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 1d10.

name: Haki Recharge
description: Your Haki Pool fully refills in 10 minutes.

name: Best Defense III
description:
When you use your reaction to block with haki, you can keep your haki up until the start of your next turn. You can roll (the amount of haki dice you spent) +10 instead of +5 to decrease damage from every attack that targets you until the start of your next turn.
Your defensive haki can now block elemental attacks, its effects aren’t halved against any dmg (still can’t defend against psychic damage)

name: Best Defense IV
description: When you use your reaction to block with haki, your haki dice grow by 1 size

name: Honed Steel III
description: You can go over your Haki Cap while defending with haki. When you choose how many haki dice to spend while defending, you can spend up to [Your Haki Cap +3].

name: Honed Steel IV
description: Whenever you spend haki dice on defense, you can use 1 extra dice for free.

name: Thick Skin III
description: As an action you can spend 9 haki points to form a small shield over your weapon/a body part for 1 minute. This gives you +3 to AC and decreases any dmg you take by 3 (per dmg source) with it for the duration or until you fall unconscious (you can use this even if your Haki Cap is less than 9)

name: Thick Skin IV
description: Thick Skin can be used with a bonus action and lasts for 10 mins

name: Protective Overdrive II
description:
As a reaction you can activate Protective Overdrive to block a single attack.
You can add 2 extra dice once per round when defending against an attack.

name: Basic Defense III
description:
Your haki dice while blocking becomes a 1d8.
You can subtract bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage taken from an attack for each haki die used (subtracted after resistance).

name: Basic Offense III
description: Your haki dice while attacking becomes a 1d8

name: Basic Defense IV
description:
Your haki dice while blocking becomes a 1d10.
You can subtract bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage taken from an attack for each haki die used (subtracted after resistance).

name: Basic Offense IV
description: Your haki dice while attacking becomes a 1d10

name: Black Blade III
description:
As an action you can spend 9 haki points to blacken your weapon/body part for 1 minute.
This gives you +3 to hit and damage with it for the duration or until you fall unconscious (you can use this even if your Haki Cap is less than 9)

name: Black Blade IV
description: As an action you can activate any level of Black Blade and it lasts up to 10 mins instead of 1.

name: One Shot I
description: As an action, you concentrate your haki into a single attack (you can only make 1 attack during this turn.) For this single attack,you can add 1 extra haki dice to the damage and your Haki Cap increases by 1.

name: One Shot II
description: As an action, you concentrate your haki into a single attack (you can only make 1 attack during this turn.) For this single attack,you can add 2 extra haki die to the damage.

name: One Shot III
description: As an action, you concentrate your haki into a single attack (you can only make 1 attack during this turn.) For this single attack,you can add 2 extra haki die to the damage and your Haki Cap increases by 2.

name: One Shot IV
description:
As an action, you concentrate your haki into a single attack (you can only make 1 attack during this turn.) For this single attack,you can add 3 extra haki die to the damage and your Haki Cap increases by 2. 
When using One Shot, your haki dice grow by 1 size.

name: Elemental Haki I
description: You can imbue your haki attacks with an element of your choice. Choose an element. When you coat an attack with haki, the weapon dmg is that element instead of physical (these attacks can still benefit from haki, as if they were physical attacks)

name: Elemental Haki II
description: You can now add your prof bonus to the damage (of that element) when you coat your attacks with haki.

name: Elemental Haki III
description: You can now add (your prof bonus + 1d10)  to the damage (of that element) when you coat your attacks with haki.

name: Best Offense III
description: As a Reaction, until the start of your next turn, you can now apply Haki to all of your attacks (can be done as part of a reaction attack of opportunity)

name: Best Offense IV
description: Your haki dice increase by 1 size when attacking

name: Honed Focus III
description: While attacking you can now spend up to (Your Haki Cap +3).

name: Honed Focus IV
description: Whenever you spend haki dice on attacks, you can use 1 extra point for free

name: Protective Overdrive III
description:
As a reaction you can activate Protective Overdrive to block a single attack.
You can increase your Haki Cap by 2 when you use the extra dice to defend

name: Protective Overdrive IV
description:
As a reaction you can activate Protective Overdrive to block a single attack.
You can add 3 extra dice once per round when defending against an attack. Your haki dice grow by 1 size when defending with the extra dice

name: Best Offense V
description: When using Best Offense, you can now make an extra attack as part of your attack action or reaction if making an attack of opportunity. You can do this (prof bonus times per long rest)

name: Honed Focus V
description: Whenever you spend haki dice on attacks, you can use 2 extra points for free

name: Black Blade V
description: When you crit with a black weapon, the crit applies to haki dmg as well

name: One Shot V
description: When using One Shot, your haki dice grow by 2 sizes

name: Best Defense V
description: you can now add +15 instead of +10 when you use it with your reaction (still can’t defend against psychic dmg)

name: Honed Steel V
description: Whenever you spend haki dice on defense, you can use 2 extra dice for free.

name: Thick Skin V
description: Thick Skin can be used with a bonus action and lasts for 10 mins

name: Protective Overdrive V
description:
As a reaction you can activate Protective Overdrive to block a single attack.
You can add 3 extra dice once per round when defending against an attack. Your haki dice grow by 1 size when defending with the extra dice

name: Haki Cap Increase III
description: Your Haki Cap increases by 1.

name: Haki Pool Increase III
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 8 or 2d8.

name: Haki Pool Increase (Gamble) III
description: Your Haki Pool increases by 1d20.

name: Haki Recharge III
description: You now regain 1 Haki point back into your Haki pool when you roll a Nat 20 on your attack rolls or saving throws.
